revised_title: Rosenhain Centenary Conference - Materials Development Present and Future
tldr: This article discusses the development of high-strength low-alloy steels for large diameter gas line pipes. It covers the changes in specifications, underlying metallurgical principles, and future trends in pipeline requirements. The focus is on improving yield strength, toughness, and weldability to ensure the integrity of the pipelines. The article also reviews the metallurgy of current line pipe steels, including grain refinement, solid solution strengthening, and precipitation strengthening.
